text: 4. Now, find a way to add one or more nodes and edges to your graph and choose a k in order to represent the clause (w V Z V y) and enforce that: at least one of w, Z, and y is true and also (still) each variable is either true or false but not both. (z isnâ€™t in this clause, which is fine. In most 3-SAT problems, not all variables are in all clauses.)
